𒀠 AL ال "(compound verb nominal element)"

𓍋 ≈ 𓍌 al / el in elephant 𓍋 𓃀 𓐍 la.baç

𒆷 LA ≈ 𒀸𒀼𒁹 al "from"

𒀠 al "(compound verb nominal element)"

The semitic prefix and suffix al is very recognizable

As article, al ال like the Spanish and Romanian el Latin ille “that one” these are ultimately derived from or co developed with del (de la) compare german 'der'. Late connection with uls “beyond”, alius “other”, and alter “the other” only in some branches.

Noun suffix -li მატყლი Tüchle ⇔ -erle -al ⇔ Adjective suffix -li -ly -tʰɛli -del (of,like) qˀvitʰɛli quittelig (yellow) ʃɑvitʰɛli schwatt

𓈒 HEL AL -ile mineral
𓏴 terminal AL < Halt End
𓏴 Tur ⇔ Kur 𒉽 ?

AL < -ful FULL -voll see 𓃾 α al'pha !

𓃴 gazelle غَزَال ḡazāl < gracefull

𒃮𒁀𒀠 ba ga-ba-al "a fight" Akk. qablu?

𒀀𒇲 a-la2 "a demon" #alû

𒉄 alla "oak acorn a suppository" #allānu
